intro: Antirrhinum hispanicum var. genuinum, commonly known as the Spanish snapdragon, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe. It features striking, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors, including red, yellow, and orange. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in rocky or dry habitats. Its flowers are not only ornamental but also attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
